definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)

sentences.english: Let me love you I won't regret.
sentences.chinese: 讓我執迷不悔的愛着你。

sentences.english: The gredinedst source of misery and hwithred in this world is clinging to past hurts.
sentences.chinese: 這個世界上難堪與仇恨最大源泉是對疇前的執迷。

sentences.english: Youre not the only one who can be obsessive.
sentences.chinese: 執迷不悟的人並不只有你。

sentences.english: If you suffer from pursuing, are you strong or stubborn?
sentences.chinese: 如果追求是苦，這是堅強還是執迷不悟？

sentences.english: It's kind of an obsession. That seems unnecessary and counterproductive.'
sentences.chinese: 這是一種執迷，看起來沒有必要，而且適得其反。

sentences.english: A 36) bigot is a stone-deaf 37) orator.
sentences.chinese: 一個執迷不悟的人是個全聾的演說家。

sentences.english: No, you can't imagine how many adults indulge themselves in model cars.
sentences.chinese: 纔不呢，你想不到有多少大人都執迷汽車模型。

sentences.english: Being remorseless, we forgot how cruelly we have treated the animals.
sentences.chinese: 執迷不悔的人們都忘了曾經橫施於動物身上的毒手。

sentences.english: I would be heart and soul, happily obsessed.
sentences.chinese: 我會全心全意，執迷不悔。

sentences.english: If you suffer from pursuing, are you strong or perverse?
sentences.chinese: 如果追求是苦，這是堅強還是執迷不悟？

sentences.english: I dream of a fall in the wake of this stubborn.
sentences.chinese: 我在這場夢中一墮不醒執迷不悟。

sentences.english: People are obsessed with the concept of savior.
sentences.chinese: 人們執迷於救世主的概念。

sentences.english: Have your dreams of a better society become an obsession?
sentences.chinese: 美好社會的夢想，能否已化爲執迷？

sentences.english: The greatest source of misery and hatred in this world is clinging to past hurts .
sentences.chinese: 這個世界上痛苦與仇恨最大源泉是對過去的執迷。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
